question: Do you understand?
transcript: Okay. So I want you to describe a time when you helped a stranger.
transcript_cleaned: Okay. So I want you to describe a time when you helped a stranger.

grammar_reason: Invalid sample.

question: Do you need help?
transcript: And he said, yeah, I am, very behind in my progress and I would like some help. So, I sat with him for a couple of hours. and he seemed pretty clueless about the final exam. So what I did is I took my previous notes from particular the particular course he taking and I went through the concepts and definitions step by step And you know I would ask him questions of where exactly he didn understand right I would use my old assignments and problems to help him solve So in the end he was able to solve most of his practice exam and he was really happy about that and we went for a little I guess that was close to midnight a little midnight snack And it was pretty relaxing we had some steak And fries at the bar, I think, yeah, a bar at the, by the university. And yeah, we exchanged the contacts and we became friends. And that made me really happy and actually caused my determination into further pursuing education in math, which is what I am doing right now. I also work as a teaching assistant, taught many university classes, everything's that. So this is definitely one of the door opening events for me to choose.

I also work as a teaching assistant, taught many university classes, everything's that. So this is definitely one of the door opening events for me to choose.

question: Why do people help strangers?
transcript: My view is, very materialistic. speaking from a psychological point of view, I think ultimately people, help strangers for themselves. Now, some people may help strangers for monetary reasons. let us say if they are getting a financial compensation, then they would go for that. But there are also some people that get a sense of joy or achievement or satisfaction after seeing the strangers sort of resolve their problems by, you know, through whatever means. And that is a psychological need as compared to a financial need I just mentioned. But either way, I think it is an internal drive rather than something external. So yeah, that is my materialistic viewpoint. Perfect.
transcript_cleaned: My view is, very materialistic. speaking from a psychological point of view, I think ultimately people, help strangers for themselves. Now, some people may help strangers for monetary reasons. let us say if they are getting a financial compensation, then they would go for that. But there are also some people that get a sense of joy or achievement or satisfaction after seeing the strangers sort of resolve their problems by, you know, through whatever means. question: Do you think people today are less willing to help others compared to the past?
transcript: From what I have noticed, definitely yes. I think, there is more, isolation or people are more distant, both physically and, psychologically from each other nowadays. it is because a lot of times we are doing things online. For example, you and I, we are, I do not know, thousands of kilometers away from each other and we are already doing these activities. It prevented us, it actually prevented us from having more chances to talk to each other and interact each other and feel each other's attitude and personality in person so that we are becoming cold in a sense. another point that I want to mention is there are trust issues. For example a lot of people are faking an injury and then would blame on whoever attempts to help And this has been very common in China especially among older age groups that they might already have some health issues and they would fake a fall or you know they would fall into a car or something and then try to blackmail the driver So I think those kind of events going viral on the Internet are also causing trust issues. As a result, people are definitely less likely to help each other. But still, I think we still have some kindness in our mind. So hopefully things change soon.
transcript_cleaned: From what I have noticed, definitely yes. I think, there is more, isolation or people are more distant, both physically and, psychologically from each other nowadays. it is because a lot of times we are doing things online. For example, you and I, we are, I do not know, thousands of kilometers away from each other and we are already doing these activities. It prevented us, it actually prevented us from having more chances to talk to each other and interact each other and feel each other's attitude and personality in person so that we are becoming cold in a sense. another point that I want to mention is there are trust issues. For example a lot of people are faking an injury and then would blame on whoever attempts to help And this has been very common in China especially among older age groups that they might already have some health issues and they would fake a fall or you know they would fall into a car or something and then try to blackmail the driver So I think those kind of events going viral on the Internet are also causing trust issues. As a result, people are definitely less likely to help each other. But still, I think we still have some kindness in our mind. So hopefully things change soon.
